Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk device-mapper-multipath
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: device-mapper-multipath bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated device-mapper-multipath packages that fix one bug are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The device-mapper-multipath packages provide tools that use the device-mapper multipath kernel module to manage multipath devices.
This update fixes the following bug:
* Previously, when a Ceph RADOS Block Device (RBD) image was exported using multiple iSCSI targets, the RBD kernel module set an exclusive lock when it received a write request. As a consequence, if a write request got unresponsive in the RBD module, and the iSCSI initiator and multipath layer decided to fail the request to the application, read requests sent after the failure did not always reflect the state of the write requests. With this update, the RBD module sets an exclusive lock for both read and write requests. This causes hung write requests to be flushed or failed before executing read requests. As a result, read requests sent after failed write requests always return the same data. (BZ#1395298)
Users of device-mapper-multipath are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
